bill_title: Honoring the 2001 Madison Bulldogs High School gymnastics team:  Kristen Osterberg, Katie Reuter, Jenessa Goeman, Kari Schaefer, Shannon Ahern, Abbie Brown, Kim Helling, Michelle Olinger, Amanda Harmon, Lindsey Prostrollo, Brooke Postma, Brittany Postma, and Michelle Cundy; student managers Lana Elpert, Stefanie Richardson, Jodie Wilkens, Lia Eastman, and Heather Namken; and coaches Diane Braskamp and Linda Collignon.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring the 2001 Madison Bulldogs High School gymnastics team: Kristen Osterberg, Katie Reuter, Jenessa Goeman, Kari Schaefer, Shannon Ahern, Abbie Brown, Kim Helling, Michelle Olinger, Amanda Harmon, Lindsey Prostrollo, Brooke Postma, Brittany Postma, and Michelle Cundy; student managers Lana Elpert, Stefanie Richardson, Jodie Wilkens, Lia Eastman, and Heather Namken; and coaches Diane Braskamp and Linda Collignon. WHEREAS, the 2001 Madison Bulldogs High School gymnastics team won the Class A state championship for the seventh year in a row proving again their tenacity to succeed and ambition towards continued excellence; and WHEREAS, teammates Jenessa Goeman, Kristen Osterberg, Kari Schaefer, and Katie Reuter placed first, second, fourth, and fifth, respectively, in the individual all-around competition. Their exceptional performances and dedication contributed greatly to the success of the season; and WHEREAS, the students of the 2001 Madison Bulldogs High School gymnastics team showed unrelenting leadership and school pride: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-sixth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that the 2001 Madison Bulldogs High School gymnastics team be recognized for their excellence in athletics for the 2000-2001 school year.

WHEREAS, the 2001 Madison Bulldogs High School gymnastics team won the Class A state championship for the seventh year in a row proving again their tenacity to succeed and ambition towards continued excellence; and WHEREAS, teammates Jenessa Goeman, Kristen Osterberg, Kari Schaefer, and Katie Reuter placed first, second, fourth, and fifth, respectively, in the individual all-around competition. Their exceptional performances and dedication contributed greatly to the success of the season; and WHEREAS, the students of the 2001 Madison Bulldogs High School gymnastics team showed unrelenting leadership and school pride: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-sixth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that the 2001 Madison Bulldogs High School gymnastics team be recognized for their excellence in athletics for the 2000-2001 school year.
